title: Space-based electronic eavesdropping becomes commercial battleground
summary: The article discusses the growing commercialization of space-based radio frequency (RF) monitoring, highlighting companies like HawkEye 360, Aerospacelab, Unseenlabs, and SAR operators such as Capella Space and ICEYE. It explores the competitive landscape, technological advancements, and challenges in the sector, including data fusion and government adoption.
why_it_matters: The transition of RF monitoring from military to commercial use signifies a major shift in space-based intelligence capabilities, with implications for maritime security, geopolitical conflicts, and the integration of commercial data into defense strategies.
